channel.title: CVE Feed for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10

item.title: CVE-2024-31474|2024-05-14T22:29:51.497Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There is an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability in the CLI service accessed by PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to delete arbitrary files on the underlying operating system, which could lead to the ability to interrupt normal operation and impact the integrity of the affected Access Point

item.title: CVE-2024-31481|2024-05-14T22:35:29.359Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: Unauthenticated Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerabilities exist in the CLI service accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected service.

item.title: CVE-2024-31478|2024-05-14T22:32:51.129Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: Multiple unauthenticated Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerabilities exists in the Soft AP daemon accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilites result in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected Access Point.

item.title: CVE-2024-31479|2024-05-14T22:34:02.959Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: Unauthenticated Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerabilities exist in the Central Communications service accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected service.

item.title: CVE-2024-31480|2024-05-14T22:34:42.949Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: Unauthenticated Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerabilities exist in the CLI service accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected service.

item.title: CVE-2024-31475|2024-05-14T22:30:27.186Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There is an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability in the Central Communications service accessed by PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to delete arbitrary files on the underlying operating system, which could lead to the ability to interrupt normal operation and impact the integrity of the affected Access Point.

item.title: CVE-2024-31468|2024-05-14T22:24:53.386Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the underlying Central Communications service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31472|2024-05-14T22:28:29.845Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There are command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying Soft AP Daemon service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31473|2024-05-14T22:29:11.994Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There is a command injection vulnerability in the underlying deauthentication service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31469|2024-05-14T22:25:46.354Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the underlying Central Communications service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31470|2024-05-14T22:26:39.056Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the underlying SAE (Simultaneous Authentication of Equals) service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31466|2024-05-14T22:21:23.483Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31467|2024-05-14T22:21:57.974Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31471|2024-05-14T22:27:21.146Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: There is a command injection vulnerability in the underlying Central Communications service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31476|2024-05-14T22:31:22.072Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: Multiple authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31483|2024-05-14T22:37:06.652Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: An authenticated sensitive information disclosure vulnerability exists in the CLI service accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to read arbitrary files in the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31482|2024-05-14T22:36:10.770Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: An unauthenticated Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the ANSI escape code service accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected Access Point.

item.title: CVE-2024-31477|2024-05-14T22:32:06.557Z -- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba InstantOS and Aruba Access Points running ArubaOS 10
item.description: Multiple authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.
